qas.question: When were DBMSs first used commercially?
What was the standard protocol called?
When was the standard protocol completed?
When were DBMSs last used commercially?

plausible_answers.text: Interest in a standard began to grow

qas.question: When was the standard taken away?
What was the name of the incomplete standard?

context: As computers grew in speed and capability, a number of general-purpose database systems emerged; by the <a0_0><b5_0>mid-1960s<b5_0/><a0_0/> a number of such systems had come into commercial use. <a2_0><b7_0>Interest in a standard<a2_0/> began to grow<b7_0/>, and Charles Bachman, author of one such product, the Integrated Data Store (IDS), founded the "<a1_0><b6_0>Database Task Group<b6_0/><a1_0/>" within CODASYL, the group responsible for the creation and standardization of COBOL. In <a4_0><b8_0>1971<b8_0/><a4_0/> the Database Task Group delivered their standard, which generally became known as the "<a3_0><b9_0>CODASYL approach<b9_0/><a3_0/>", and soon a number of commercial products based on this approach entered the market.
